description: Also from the Front Page newsletter: Sacha Baron Cohen attacks TikTok for fostering anti-Semitism. Sign up below.
maintext:
Good evening.
The IDF has praised its forces for approaching military work in northern Gaza “successfully”.
Meanwhile, Sacha Baron Cohen has attacked TikTok for fostering abuse against Jewish people.
IDF ‘close to dismantling military system’ in northern Gaza
Israel’s military says it is close to “dismantling the military system” set up by Hamas in northern Gaza.
Herzi Halevi, the Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) chief of general staff, told forces in the enclave there “remains work to be completed” but praised them for “approaching it successfully.”
Sacha Baron Cohen accuses TikTok of ‘creating biggest anti-Semitic movement since Nazis’
Sacha Baron Cohen, the actor, has accused TikTok of “creating the biggest anti-Semitic movement since the Nazis” as the video app battles allegations it is fostering a flood of abuse against Jewish people.
Baron Cohen said TikTok was feeding images to young users encouraging hate, telling TikTok executives: “Shame on you.”
No 10 won’t rule out MPs working over Christmas on Sunak’s Rwanda laws
Downing Street has not ruled out the prospect of MPs working over the Christmas period to get Rishi Sunak’s emergency Rwanda legislation through Parliament.
The House of Commons is scheduled to rise for its Christmas break on December 19, with MPs due to return to work on January 8. But No 10 said it was “prepared to do whatever is necessary to ensure that we can get this in place and get flights off the ground”.
Evening Briefing: Today’s essential headlines
David Cameron | The former prime minDavid Cameron will now be known as Lord Cameron of Chipping Norton after he selected the Cotswolds town for his territorial designation.
Battle Lines Podcast | Israel hunts for Hamas while Gaza’s hospitals collapse
In this episode of Battle Lines, Senior Foreign Correspondent Sophia Yan analyses some of the diplomatic moves made by Middle Eastern states close to the conflict. Telegraph Global Health Reporter Lilia Sebouai updates us on the conditions In Gaza’s hospitals, and Foreign Reporter Verity Bowman talks us through the Israeli assault on the Al-Shifa hospital.
Readers’ View: ‘C
ome the general election, millions of natural Conservatives will not bother to vote’
Earlier this week, we asked Front Page readers for their views on David Cameron’s appointment as Foreign Secretary. Thanks to everyone who responded. Read the best of the debate from readers.
Comment and analysis
World news: Controversial project in Vietnam threatens paradise of popular tourist destination Ha Long Bay
Pictures of construction have provoked green concerns for the aquamarine waters of a Unesco World Heritage site.
Business news: Barclay family bid to regain control of The Telegraph with Gulf cash
The Barclay family have made an offer to repay in full a £1.2bn debt to Lloyds Banking Group and reassume control of The Telegraph in a potential deal bac
ked by Manchester City owner Sheikh Mansour bin Zayed.
Live business news: Households dealing with ‘peak’ pain from interest rates, says Bank of England official
Editor’s choice
Life | The seven new types of old age – and how to tell which one you are
Food | How to make your meat go further – delicious recipes which use up every morsel
Fashion | Why leather trousers are the most controversial style a man can wear

fing Newsletter to receive the latest sporting news, direct to your inbox every weekday morning.
Three things for you
title: Friday evening news briefing: Hamas military system nearly dismantled in northern Gaza, says Israel
